title: How to Make Oatmeal
ingredients_raw: ['½ cup old fashioned rolled oats', '1 cup water or milk', 'pinch of sea salt', '¼ teaspoon of ground cinnamon (optional)', '¼ teaspoon vanilla extract (optional)', '½ cup chopped apple', 'sprinkle of cinnamon', '½ Tablespoon maple syrup', '1-2 Tablespoons brown sugar', 'banana slices', '2 Tablespoons toasted walnuts', '½ Tablespoon peanut butter', '¼ teaspoon chia seeds', '¼ cup fresh berries', '2 Tablespoons chopped roasted almonds', '1 Tablespoon chocolate chips']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "old fashioned rolled oats", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "water or milk", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "pinch of sea salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "ground cinnamon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "vanilla extract", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "chopped apple", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sprinkle of cinnamon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "maple syrup", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "brown sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "banana slices", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "toasted walnuts", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "peanut butter", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "chia seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "fresh berries", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "chopped roasted almonds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "chocolate chips", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Add oats, water or milk, salt, cinnamon and vanilla (if using) to a pot or saucepan over medium/high heat.
Cook
Bring mixture to a low boil, reduce heat to a low simmer and continue to cook for about 5-7 minutes; stirring occasionally. Oatmeal is ready when the oats have soaked up most of the liquid and are creamy.
Serve
Transfer to a bowl and add toppings of choice. See flavor ideas above for maple brown sugar, apple cinnamon, banana nut and berry almond variations.

title: Protein Overnight Oats
ingredients_raw: ['½ cup old fashioned rolled oats', '¾ cup unsweetened vanilla almond milk', '1 scoop vanilla protein powder', '½ Tablespoon chia seeds', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '¼ teaspoon cinnamon', '½ cup fresh berries (for topping)', '½ Tablespoon almond butter (for topping)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "old fashioned rolled oats", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "unsweetened vanilla almond milk", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "vanilla protein powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "chia seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "vanilla extract", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cinnamon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "fresh berries", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "almond butter", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Combine all ingredients except the toppings in a small container.
Cover container with a lid and place in the fridge overnight (or at least 1-2 hours).
Bring out of the fridge in the morning and stir. You'll notice that the protein powder, oats and chia seeds soak up a lot of the liquid so you may want to add a little more almond milk or water before serving.
Top with toppings of your choice and enjoy. I used ½ cup blueberries and ½ Tablespoon almond butter for the nutrition facts on these.

title: Blueberry Baked Oatmeal
ingredients_raw: ['2 cups rolled old-fashioned oats', '¼ cup pure maple syrup', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon sea salt', '2 cups unsweetened vanilla almond milk', '1 Tablespoon ground flaxseed (or 1 large egg)', '2 Tablespoons coconut oil (melted)', '2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract', '2 ripe bananas (mashed)', '1 ¼ cups fresh or frozen blueberries (divided)', 'additional blueberries (nut butter and extra maple syrup, for serving)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "rolled old-fashioned oats", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "pure maple syrup", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "baking powder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "ground cinnamon", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sea salt", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "unsweetened vanilla almond milk", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "ground flaxseed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "coconut oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "vanilla extract", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "ripe bananas", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "fresh or frozen blueberries", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "nut butter", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "maple syrup", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 375°F and spray 8-inch square baking dish with cooking spray.
Mix
In a large bowl, mix together the oats, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.
Combine
Add in the milk, maple syrup, egg, coconut oil, vanilla and bananas. Stir well to combine. Gently fold in 1 cup of blueberries.
Top
Carefully pour oatmeal mixture into the prepared baking dish. Scatter the remaining blueberries across the top.
Bake for 40 to 55 minutes or until the middle of the bake is set and the top is golden. Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes. Portion and serve. Top with additional fresh blueberries and nut butter, if using. Drizzle each portion with maple syrup if you want it a bit sweeter.
Store in the refrigerator in an airtight container for up to 5 days.
Reheat
To reheat the whole baked oatmeal, cover with foil and reheat in a 350°F oven for about 20 minutes. For individual portions, set oven (or toaster oven) to 350°F and bake for 5-10 minutes or reheat in the microwave for 1 minute.

title: Carrot Cake Overnight Oats
ingredients_raw: ['½ cup oats', '¾ cup unsweetened almond milk (or any milk )', '3 Tablespoons grated carrots', '½ - 1 Tablespoon maple syrup', '½ Tablespoon raisins', '½ teaspoon cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon vanilla', '¼ teaspoon almond extract (optional)', '1 Tablespoon unsweetened flaked coconut', '1 Tablespoon chopped walnuts or pecans (for topping)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "grated carrots", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "maple syrup", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "unsweetened flaked coconut", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "chopped walnuts or pecans", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Combine
Place all ingredients except the nuts in a container and stir until well combined. Seal with a lid and place in the fridge overnight (or at least a couple hours).
Serve
Bring out of the fridge in the morning and stir. You'll notice that the oats soak up a lot of the liquid so you may want to add a little more almond milk before serving. Top oats with chopped nuts and serve.

title: Roasted Harvest Bowls
ingredients_raw: ['1 lb skinless boneless chicken breasts or thighs (sliced)', '½ Tablespoon olive or avocado oil', '2 ½ Tablespoons pure maple syrup', '1 Tablespoons low sodium tamari (or soy sauce)', '1 teaspoon garlic (minced)', '½ teaspoon ground turmeric', '½ teaspoon sea salt', '½ teaspoon pepper', '16 oz brussels sprouts (trimmed and quartered)', '1 large butternut squash (peeled and chopped)', '2 Tablespoons avocado or olive oil (divided )', '½ teaspoon sea salt (divided )', '½ teaspoon pepper (divided )', '1 crisp apple (chopped)', 'Chopped curly kale', 'Pepitas', 'Dried cranberries', 'Goat cheese', 'Cinnamon and cayenne pepper (optional)', '¼ cup apple cider vinegar', '½ cup olive oil', '2 teaspoons Dijon mustard', '2 teaspoons maple syrup', '1 Tablespoon garlic (minced)', '1 teaspoon salt (plus more to taste )', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper (plus more to taste )']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "skinless boneless chicken breasts or thighs", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "olive or avocado oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "pure maple syrup", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "low sodium tamari", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "ground turmeric", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sea salt", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "brussels sprouts", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "butternut squash", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "avocado or olive oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sea salt", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "apple", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "curly kale", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "pepitas", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dried cranberries", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "goat cheese", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "apple cider vinegar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "olive oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Dijon mustard", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "maple syrup", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "pepper", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Make dressing by adding all ingredients into a blender and blending until smooth. Set aside
Prep
Preheat oven to 400°F. Prep one extra large baking sheet or 2 medium baking sheets with parchment paper.
Roast veggies
Add chopped butternut squash chunks into a bowl and toss with 1 Tablespoon oil, ¼ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon pepper. Feel free to add a sprinkle of cinnamon and cayenne as well. Toss to coat and spread onto a baking sheet. In the same bowl, add the brussels sprouts and toss with 1 Tablespoon of oil, remaining salt and pepper. Save bowl for later! Place on the other side of the baking sheet (or the additional baking sheet). Put butternut squash and brussels sprouts into the oven and roast for 30-40 minutes, or until squash is tender, flipping halfway.
Sear chicken
While veggies are roasting cook chicken. Add oil to a cast iron skillet and turn heat on medium/medium-high heat. Pat chicken dry and season with sea salt and black pepper. At this point your oil should be hot and the chicken should sizzle when added to the skillet. Add chicken to the skillet and sear for 4-5 minutes on each side.
Bake chicken
While chicken is searing combine maple syrup, tamari, garlic, turmeric and black pepper in a small bowl. Once both sides of the chicken are seared, carefully pour maple turmeric sauce over chicken and toss to coat. Move skillet from the stovetop into the preheated 400°F oven and bake for 10 minutes or until chicken is tender and cooked throughout.
Massage kale
Add kale to the same bowl you used to toss the butternut and brussels. Drizzle on 1-2 tablespoons of the dressing and use your hands to massage it into the kale.
Assemble
To make bowls, add a base of kale to each bowl, top with maple turmeric chicken, roasted Brussels sprouts, roasted butternut squash, apple chunks, dried cranberries, pepitas and goat cheese. Drizzle dressing over the bowl and enjoy!

title: Easy Shakshuka
ingredients_raw: ['2 Tablespoons olive oil', '1 large onion (chopped)', '1 orange bell pepper (chopped)', '4 cloves garlic (minced)', '½ teaspoon cumin', '½ teaspoon paprika', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1-2 teaspoons curry powder', '¼ teaspoon turmeric', '½ teaspoon sea salt', '¼ teaspoon ground pepper', '28 ounce can diced tomatoes', '4-5 eggs', '½ cup feta cheese', 'fresh cilantro and parsley (for serving)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "olive oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "orange bell pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cumin", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "paprika", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cayenne pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "curry powder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "turmeric", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sea salt", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "ground pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "diced tomatoes", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "eggs", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "feta cheese", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cilantro", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "parsley", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Saute
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, bell pepper and garlic to the skillet and cook until onions are soft and fragrant — about 5 to 10 minutes.
Cook sauce
Add cumin, paprika, cayenne, curry, turmeric, salt and pepper. Give the mixture a stir and cook for about 1 minute more. Add diced tomatoes to the skillet and bring sauce to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until the sauce thickens up a bit, about 10 minutes. Add feta cheese to the tomato mixture and stir.
Cook eggs
Crack eggs into tomato sauce. You should be able to fit 4-5 eggs in a large skillet. Cover and let the eggs cook for about 5 minutes, or until the egg whites are completely cooked through. Remove skillet from heat, uncover and let sit for a 1-2 minutes before serving.
Serve
Spoon 1-2 eggs along with a big serving of tomato sauce on to each plate. Garnish with extra feta cheese and fresh cilantro and parsley. Serve with toast, veggies or over a whole grain like quinoa or brown rice for a complete meal.

title: Ground Turkey Pasta
ingredients_raw: ['8 oz cellentani/cavatappi dry pasta', '1 Tablespoon olive oil', '½ yellow onion (chopped )', '2 large garlic cloves (minced )', '1 red bell pepper (chopped)', '1 lb ground turkey', '1 ½ teaspoons Italian seasoning', '¾ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 15 oz can tomato sauce', '¼ cup canned coconut milk', '1 Tablespoon balsamic vinegar', '2 oz cream cheese (dairy-free, if needed)', '¼ -½ cup reserved pasta water', '3 cups spinach', 'Parmesan cheese (for topping)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "cellentani/cavatappi dry pasta", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "olive oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "yellow onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic cloves", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "red bell pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "ground turkey", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Italian seasoning", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "ground black pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "tomato sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "coconut milk", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "balsamic vinegar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cream cheese", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "spinach", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "parmesan cheese", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Cook pasta according to package directions. Reserve ½ cup pasta water before draining. Set aside.
Saute veggies
While pasta is cooking, heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion, bell pepper and garlic and saute for 3-4 minutes until onion starts to soften and become fragrant.
Cook turkey
Add ground turkey, Italian seasoning, salt and pepper. Cook for 6-7 minutes until turkey is fully cooked, breaking it up with a wooden spoon as it cooks.
Simmer
Add tomato sauce, coconut milk, balsamic vinegar, cream cheese and ¼ cup reserved pasta water to turkey mixture. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer.
Add spinach and let the sauce simmer for a few minutes until spinach has wilted.
Combine
Add pasta to the sauce and stir to coat. Add additional pasta water if needed to reach desired consistency.
Serve topped with freshly shredded parmesan cheese. Enjoy!

title: Kale and Sweet Potato Brown Rice Bowls
ingredients_raw: ['1 large sweet potato (cut into ¼ inch chunks )', '1 teaspoon olive oil (or avocado oil )', '1 cup cooked brown rice (or quinoa)', '2 cups steamed kale', '½ cup cooked chickpeas', '¼ cup peanut butter', '1 clove garlic (chopped)', '2 teaspoons fresh ginger (chopped)', '2 Tablespoons rice vinegar', '2 Tablespoons low sodium gluten-free tamari (or soy sauce)', '2 Tablespoons maple syrup', 'a pinch of cayenne pepper (optional)', 'water (to thin)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "sweet potato", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "kale", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "chickpeas", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "peanut butter", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "ginger", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "rice vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "tamari", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "maple syrup", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cayenne pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "water", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Cook sweet potatoes
Chop 1 large sweet potato into ¼ inch chunks, drizzle 1 teaspoon of oil and sprinkle with a little sea salt. Bake at 400° F for 30 minutes or until sweet potatoes are fork tender.
Cook rice
Cook brown rice according to package instructions while sweet potatoes are roasting.
Cook kale
Prepare kale by washing, de-stemming and chopping. Then steam in a steamer basket for 3-5 mins or until tender. You can blanch or sauté the kale if you'd rather.
Make sauce
Make peanut sauce by blending all the sauce ingredients in a blender until smooth. Add water to thin sauce and create desired consistency.
Assemble and serve
Once all ingredients are prepped, grab two bowls and evenly distribute brown rice, kale, chickpeas and sweet potato chunks between both. Drizzle each with as much peanut sauce as you'd like. Serve warm or at room-temp.

title: One Pan Chicken Sausage and Orzo
ingredients_raw: ['1 Tablespoon olive oil', '1 cup chopped yellow onion', '4 cloves garlic (minced)', '1 12 oz package mild Italian Chicken sausage (4 sausages, cut into 1” chunks (I used the Whole Foods brand))', '2 cups dry orzo', '4 cups chicken broth (or chicken bone broth for more protein)', '1 teaspoon Italian seasoning', '¼ teaspoon sea salt', '¼ teaspoon pepper', '½ cup canned full fat coconut milk (or heavy cream)', '½ cup freshly grated parmesan', '5 oz baby spinach', 'Crushed red pepper (for serving (optional))', 'Fresh basil (for garnish)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "olive oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "yellow onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Italian Chicken sausage", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dry orzo", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "chicken broth", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Italian seasoning", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sea salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "coconut milk", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "freshly grated parmesan", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "baby spinach", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "fresh basil", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Saute
Add oil to a large skillet over medium heat. Once hot add onion and garlic and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring often.
Cook
Add chicken sausage into the pan and saute for another 5-6 minutes or until golden.
Boil
Add orzo to the pan and toss for 1 minute to toast and then add the chicken broth, coconut milk, salt, pepper and Italian seasoning. Bring the orzo to a boil and then cover and reduce to a simmer. Cook for 10-12 minutes or until orzo is cooked.
Serve
Add spinach and parmesan. Mix well until spinach is wilted and parmesan has melted. Serve with extra parmesan cheese, fresh basil and crushed red pepper, if desired.

title: No Bake Protein Balls
ingredients_raw: ['1 ½ cups old fashioned rolled oats', '1 cup natural peanut butter', '¼ cup honey or maple syrup', '2 scoops', '2 Tablespoons chocolate chips', '1 ½ cups old fashioned rolled oats', '1 cup natural almond butter', '¼ cup honey or maple syrup', '2 scoops', '1-2 Tablespoons unsweetened shredded coconut', '1 ½ cups old fashioned rolled oats', '1 cup cashew butter', '¼ cup honey or maple syrup', '2 scoops', '2 Tablespoons raisins', '¼ teaspoon cinnamon', '2 cups old fashioned rolled oats', '1 cup tahini', '¼ cup honey or maple syrup', '2 scoops', '2 Tablespoons mini chocolate chips']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "rolled oats", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "peanut butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "honey or maple syrup", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "protein powder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "chocolate chips", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "almond butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "shredded coconut", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cashew butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "raisins", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "tahini", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Chocolate Peanut Butter
Place oats, peanut butter, honey, protein powder and chocolate chips in a large bowl and stir to combine.
Getting the mixture to combine takes a little arm muscle and it may seem too thick at first, but it will come together as you keep mixing. I used my hands to knead the dough near the end and that seems to help.
Once combined, use a small cookie scoop to scoop and form the dough into balls.
Store in a covered container in the fridge or freezer.
Almond Joy
Place oats, almond butter, honey, protein powder and shredded coconut in a large bowl and stir to combine.
Getting the mixture to combine takes a little arm muscle and it may seem too thick at first, but it will come together as you keep mixing. I used my hands to knead the dough near the end and that seems to help.
Once combined, use a small cookie scoop to scoop and form the dough into balls.
Store in a covered container in the fridge or freezer.
Cinnamon Raisin Cookie
Place oats, cashew butter, honey, protein powder, raisins and cinnamon in a large bowl and stir to combine.
Getting the mixture to combine takes a little arm muscle and it may seem a little crumbly at first, but it will come together as you keep mixing. I used my hands to knead the dough near the end and that seems to help.
Once combined, use a small cookie scoop to scoop and form the dough into balls.
Store in a covered container in the fridge or freezer.
Tahini Chocolate Chip
Place oats, tahini, honey, protein powder and chocolate chips in a large bowl and stir to combine.
Getting the mixture to combine takes a little arm muscle and it may seem too thick at first, but it will come together as you keep mixing. I used my hands to knead the dough near the end and that seems to help.
Once combined, use a small cookie scoop to scoop and form the dough into balls.
Store in a covered container in the fridge or freezer.

title: Healthy 7 Layer Dip
ingredients_raw: ['1 15 oz can refried beans', '1 cup plain Greek yogurt', '2 teaspoons taco seasoning', '1 cup guacamole (store-bought or homemade)', '1 cup pico de gallo or salsa (store-bought or homemade)', '⅓ cup shredded Mexican cheese or crumbled queso fresco', '1 cup shredded romaine lettuce', '½ jalapeño (deseeded and chopped)', '¼ cup diced cherry tomatoes', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '¼ cup sliced black olives (optional)', 'tortilla chips (for serving)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "refried beans", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "plain Greek yogurt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "taco seasoning", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "guacamole", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "pico de gallo", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "shredded romaine lettuce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "deseeded and chopped jalape\u00f1o", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "diced cherry tomatoes", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "chopped fresh cilant0r", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sliced black olives", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "tortilla chips", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Season yogurt
Mix yogurt with 2 teaspoons of taco seasoning in a small bowl.
Layer
Spread refried beans evenly into the bottle of a square (8 x 8) dish to create the first layer. Add seasoned yogurt on top and gently spread to create the second layer. Then add the guacamole and spread.
Drain
Scoop salsa with a slotted spoon. This step is optional, but it helps to remove extra liquid from the salsa.
Layer
Add pico de gallo on top of the guacamole and then add remaining ingredients in the order listed: shredded cheese, romaine lettuce, jalapeño pepper, cherry tomatoes, cilantro and black olives, if using.
Enjoy
Serve immediately or store in the fridge until ready. Serve with tortilla chips, crackers or fresh veggies for dipping. Best served the day you make it, but will keep in the fridge for 1-2 days.

title: Guacamole
ingredients_raw: ['3 large ripe avocados', 'Juice from 1 lime (2 Tablespoons)', '½ cup grape tomatoes (diced )', '½ cup red onion (chopped)', '1 jalapeño (seeded and minced)', '¼ cup fresh cilantro (chopped )', '2 cloves fresh garlic (minced )', '½ teaspoon sea salt (plus more to taste)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "avocados", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "lime juice", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "grape tomatoes", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "red onion", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "jalape\u00f1o", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cilantror", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sea salt", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Slice avocados
Slice your avocados in half, remove the pits and scoop the flesh of the avocados into a large mixing bowl.
Combine
Add the rest of your ingredients to the bowl.
Mash
Stir together with a fork, until combined, but still chunky, mashing the avocado as you stir.
Serve
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Serve with an assortment of raw vegetables and tortilla chips.

title: Healthy Smash Cake (For Baby's First Birthday)
ingredients_raw: ['1 ½ cups (133 grams) fine blanched almond flour (not packed)', '½ cup (140 grams) ripe mashed banana*', '2 large eggs', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '½ teaspoon cinnamon', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '⅛ teaspoon salt', 'coconut whipped topping (homemade or store-bought OR plain full-fat yogurt OR frosting of choice)', 'fresh berries or sprinkles']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "almond flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "ripe mashed banana", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "eggs", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "vanilla extract", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cinnamon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "baking powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "coconut whipped topping", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "fresh berries", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sprinkles", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Prep
Preheat oven to 350°F and spray 3 (4-inch) mini springform pans with cooking spray. Set aside.
Blend
Whisk eggs in a medium mixing bowl. Add mashed banana and vanilla. Stir until combined.
Combine
Add almond flour, cinnamon, baking powder and salt. Stir until just combined.
Bake
Divide batter evenly between the 3 springform pans and bake for 20 minutes or until the tops of the cakes are golden in color and an inserted toothpick comes out clean.
Cool
Remove cakes from the oven, let cool for 10-20 minutes before carefully removing from the pans.
Decorate
Let layers cool completely before stacking and icing with frosting of choice. I've tested plain full-fat yogurt as well as coconut whipped topping. For toppings, I like the idea of naturally-colored sprinkles or fresh berries.

Add all ingredients for the combo you're making into a high powered blender or a food processor. Blend until you reach the consistency you desire. You can make the purees smooth and more liquidy for young babies or thicker and chunkier for older babies.

title: Banana Oatmeal Pancakes for Babies
ingredients_raw: ['3/4 cup old fashioned rolled oats (quick oats will also work)', '1 ripe banana', '1 egg', 'pinch of cinnamon', '1/4 cup milk (any type of milk will work)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "old fashioned rolled oats", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "ripe banana", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "egg", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cinnamon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "milk", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Blend
Place all ingredients into a blender and blend until smooth. Pour batter onto a warm, greased skillet. I did about 1 Tablespoon of batter for each pancake to keep them small.
Cook until the batter starts to form little bubbles and you can easily get under the pancake with a spatula. Flip pancake and cook for another 1-2 minutes or until pancake is cooked through.
Serve whole or break into pieces for tiny hands. You can serve these plain, with a little nut butter or yogurt spread on top or with a fruit puree to dip the pancakes in.
Store
Cool the pancakes completely on a wire rack before storing in an airtight container. Refrigerate for up to 5 days or freeze for up to a month.

title: Baby Oatmeal
ingredients_raw: ['1/4 cup old fashioned rolled oats', '3/4 cup water', '1/4 banana (sliced)', 'pinch of cinnamon', '1 teaspoon ground flax or chia seeds (optional)', '1-2 teaspoons peanut butter', 'breastmilk (formula or water to thin, if needed)', 'toppings of choice: fresh berries (more peanut butter, more bananas)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "old fashioned rolled oats", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "water", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "banana (sliced)", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cinnamon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "ground flax or chia seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "peanut butter", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "breastmilk (formula or water to thin, if needed)", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "fresh berries", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Add oats, banana slices and cinnamon into a pot. Add water and stir to combine. Heat over medium-high heat for 5-7 minutes or until all the liquid has been absorbed. Be sure to stir the oats several times while cooking to make sure the banana slices melt into the oats. You’ll know the oatmeal is done when all the water has been absorbed and the oats are creamy and fluffy.
Remove pot from heat and stir in ground flax and peanut butter, if using.
Portion oats into a bowl and let cool before serving. Oats can be warm, but you don't want them to be too hot. If the oats are too thick (sometimes this happens as the oats cool) add a splash of breast milk, formula or water to thin. Feel free to add toppings like fresh berries, more peanut butter or banana chunks.

title: Protein Chia Pudding
ingredients_raw: ['1 scoop (25 grams) vanilla protein powder', '1 ¼-½ cups unsweetened vanilla almond milk (plus more as needed)', '4 Tablespoons chia seeds', '½ Tablespoon maple syrup (honey or sweetener of choice)', '¼ teaspoon vanilla extract (optional)', '½ cup Greek yogurt (or non-dairy yogurt)', 'Granola (for topping)', 'Toppings: fresh berries (granola and nut butter.)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "vanilla protein powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "unsweetened vanilla almond milk", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "chia seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "maple syrup", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "vanilla extract", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Greek yogurt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Granola", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "fresh berries", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Whisk
In a bowl or mason jar, whisk together almond milk and protein powder until protein powder has dissolved. If you’re using a mason jar, you can put the lid on and shake the mixture to combine.
Stir
Add chia seeds, maple syrup and vanilla. Stir or shake mixture until well combined. Once the chia pudding mixture is well combined, let it sit for 5 minutes, give it another stir/shake to break up any clumps of chia seeds.
Set
Cover and put the mixture in the fridge to “set" for 1-2 hours or overnight. The chia pudding should be nice and thick, not liquidy.
Serve
When ready to serve, portion chia pudding into two glasses with layers of granola, if desired. Top with ¼ cup Greek yogurt each, fresh berries, additional granola and nut butter or toppings of choice.

title: Protein Baked Oatmeal
ingredients_raw: ['2 cups old fashioned rolled oats', '½ cup vanilla protein powder (I used Sun Warrior)', '2 cups unsweetened almond milk (or any dairy-free milk)', '¼ cup peanut butter (or any nut butter)', '2 large eggs (or flax eggs)', '3 Tablespoons maple syrup', '1 Tablespoon coconut oil (melted)', '1 teaspoon vanilla', '¼ teaspoon salt', '½ cup fresh blueberries (plus more for topping)', 'nut butter (for drizzling on top)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "old fashioned rolled oats", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "vanilla protein powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "unsweetened almond milk", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "peanut butter", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "large eggs", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "maple syrup", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "coconut oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "vanilla", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "fresh blueberries", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "nut butter", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Prep
Preheat oven to 375°F and spray a 8-inch square baking dish with cooking spray.
Mix
In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, almond milk, peanut butter, eggs, maple syrup, coconut oil, vanilla and salt.
Pour
Stir in blueberries and carefully pour oatmeal mixture into the prepared baking dish. Top with additional blueberries.
Bake for 35-40 minutes or until center is set. Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes. Portion and serve with a drizzle of nut butter.

title: Protein Muffins
ingredients_raw: ['1 cup mashed banana', '3 large eggs', '¼ cup maple syrup', '1 cup natural drippy almond butter (I used Wild Friends)', '2 Tablespoons almond milk', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '½ cup vanilla protein powder (I used Sun Warrior)', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '¼ teaspoon sea salt (skip if almond butter is salted)', '½ cup chocolate chips']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "mashed banana", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "eggs", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "maple syrup", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "natural drippy almond butter", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "almond milk", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "vanilla extract", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "vanilla protein powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "baking powder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sea salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "chocolate chips", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Prep
Preheat oven to 350°F. Prepare muffin tin by spraying well with cooking spray, or line the tins with paper muffin liners or silicone liners. Set aside.
Blend
In your blender add all ingredients (except the chocolate chips) and blend on high-speed until creamy, about 1 minute.
Stir in chocolate chips with a spatula.
Fill muffin tin
Fill each muffin cavity about 3/4 full with the muffin batter. Top each muffin with chocolate chips.
Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until the tops are set and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool
Allow muffins to cool for 5-10 minutes or until they are firm and cool enough to handle. Remove from tin and let cool completely on a wire rack.

title: Protein Pancakes
ingredients_raw: ['½ cup liquid egg whites', '1 scoop (25 grams) vanilla protein powder', '1 banana, mashed', '¼ cup oat flour', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '1-3 Tablespoons almond milk', '¼ cup chocolate chips (optional)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "\u00bd cup liquid egg whites", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "1 scoop (25 grams) vanilla protein powder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "1 banana, mashed", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "\u00bc cup oat flour", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "\u00bd teaspoon baking powder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "1-3 Tablespoons almond milk", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "\u00bc cup chocolate chips (optional)", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Whisk
In a small bowl whisk together the egg whites and protein powder with a fork or whisk until all the protein powder is dissolved. I find that a whisk does a great job for mixing in the protein powder.
Combine
Stir in the mashed banana, oat flour and baking powder. Add the chocolate chips, if desired. If the pancake mixture seems too thick you can add almond milk to thin it out a bit (add 1 T at a time).
Cook
Spray a medium sized non-stick pan with cooking spray and set heat to low-medium (I use the number 3 on my stove). The lower heat is the key to making sure the pancakes don't burn. Pour in pancake batter (I use ¼ cup for each) and cook until little bubbles form (about 3-5 minutes).
Flip
Make sure the pancakes have set enough before you try flipping them, or else you’ll end up with a scramble. Carefully flip the pancakes over to the other side. Cook until pancakes are done in the middle (typically takes another 2-3 minutes).
Serve
Place pancakes on a plate, top with your favorite pancake toppings. I like these with a drizzle of maple syrup, peanut butter and extra chocolate chips. Makes 4-5 pancakes.
Store in the refrigerator for up to 7 days or in the freezer for up to 1 month. When you're ready to enjoy, you can eat them cold if you'd like but I like to reheat the pancakes by popping them in the toaster oven or microwave for 30 seconds - 1 minute. If frozen, you can thaw them in the fridge or pop in the microwave to thaw and reheat.

title: Chocolate Pancakes with Raspberries
ingredients_raw: ['2 eggs', '10 ozs milk', '8.75 ozs Whole Grain Spelt Flour', '3 Tbsps cocoa powder', '2 Tbsps finely ground Birch sugar', '12 ozs Raspberries', '2.25 ozs apple sauce (unsweetened)', '8 tsps Canola oil', '4 tsps Crème fraiche']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "eggs", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "milk", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "whole grain spelt flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cocoa powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "birch sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "raspberries", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "apple sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "canola oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Mix eggs, milk, flour, 2 tablespoons cocoa powder and birch sugar to a smooth dough and let it swell for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, wash raspberries. Mix 10 ounces of them with applesauce, crushing the berries.
Heat a large frying pan and bake 8 pancakes one after the other. To do this, coat each pan with 1 tsp. oil, pour in 1 ladle of batter and cook over medium heat for 2-3 minutes per side. Keep warm in preheated oven at 80 °C / 175 ˚F.
To serve, fill the pancakes with 2-3 tbsp. raspberry mixture and roll up. Arrange 2 pancakes on plates and place 1 tsp. crème fraîche next to them. Dust everything with remaining cocoa powder and garnish with remaining raspberries.

title: Greek Lemon Soup
ingredients_raw: ['1 small chicken (28 ounces)', '36 ozs Vegetable broth', '2 bay leaves', '0.5 tsp peppercorns', '1 generous pinch salt', '3.5 ozs parboiled rice', '3 Tbsps olive oil', '2 Tbsps Whole Grain Spelt Flour', '14 ozs milk (whole)', '1 organic lemon', '1 generous pinch peppers', '1 bunch Dill']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "small chicken", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "vegetable broth", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "bay leaves", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "peppercorns", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "parboiled rice", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "olive oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "whole grain spelt flour", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "milk (whole)", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "organic lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "peppers", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "dill", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Rinse chicken and cover with broth in a large pot. Slowly bring to a boil, skimming off any foam that rises. Once foam is no longer rising and water is simmering gently, add spices to chicken. Add a little salt and simmer, covered, over low heat for about 1 hour, until meat separates easily from bones.
Along the way, cook rice in salted water according to package directions, drain and drain.
Lift chicken out of broth, let cool and pluck meat from bones. Filter the broth through a sieve and collect.
Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a saucepan. Stir in flour and sauté over medium heat, stirring. Deglaze with milk and bring to a boil over low heat while stirring. Add 16 ounces broth and boil again (refrigerate remaining broth for another dish).
Rinse lemon and cut in half, squeeze 1 half. Season soup with salt, lemon juice and pepper to taste and heat chicken in it over medium heat for 5 minutes. Arrange rice in deep plates, top with soup and meat. Wash dill, shake dry and chop. Sprinkle Greek lemon soup with dill, drizzle with remaining olive oil and pepper over. Slice remaining lemon half and divide among plates.

title: Potato u0026amp; Onion Rosti 马铃薯洋葱煎饼
ingredients_raw: ['4 potatoes, approx 300-320g', '1 onion, thinly sliced', '55g butter, melted', '1/2 tsp salt', 'Few pinches of grind black pepper', 'Some cooking oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "potatoes", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "black pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Grate the potatoes into long thin shreds with a grater or food processor. Squeeze out the excess water from the potatoes.
Add in sliced onions, melted butter, salt and pepper and mix well.
Press the mixture together to form patties.
Pour a thin layer of cooking oil into pan. The amount of oil should cover the entire base of the pan. Dip a chopstick into the oil and if bubbles form around it, the oil is ready.
Add in the potatoes patties and pan-fried till browned on one side before flipping over.
Once done, drain the Rosti on paper towels to soak up the excess oils. Serve hot immediately to enjoy !

title: Seafood Longevity Noodles 海鲜长寿面
ingredients_raw: ['2 servings of Yee Fu Noodles', '3 tbsp cooking oil', '2 tsp minced garlic', '2 tsp minced ginger', '4 bunches of spring onions, cut into sections', 'A handful of beansprouts', 'Some shredded carrots', '5 scallops', '5 shrimps', '4 dried shiitake mushrooms, soak in water till softened and sliced, retain mushroom water', '2 tbsp mushroom oyster sauce', '2 tbsp light soya sauce', '1 1/2 tsp dark soya sauce', '2 tsp sugar', '1 tsp sesame oil', 'Pinch of salt and pepper', '100ml noodles water', '2 tbsp mushroom water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Yee Fu Noodles", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "minced garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "minced ginger", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "spring onions", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "beansprouts", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "shredded carrots", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "scallops", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "shrimps", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dried shiitake mushrooms", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "mushroom oyster sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "light soya sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dark soya sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sesame oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "noodles water", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "mushroom water", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Heat up a pot of water and blanched the Yee Fu noodles till done. Drain the noodles and set aside the noodles water.
Heat up 1 tbsp of cooking oil and grill scallops till lightly browned. Add in shrimps and grill till done. Remove all and set aside.
Add in balance 2 tbsp cooking oil and stir fry minced garlic, ginger and white parts of spring onion till aromatic. Add in sliced mushrooms and noodles. Stir fry briefly and mix well.
Add in the noodles water, seasoning and mushroom water. Stir fry to ensure noodles are evenly browned. Cover the wok and allow the noodles to simmer in the sauce till almost dry.
Add in beansprouts, green parts of spring onions and shredded carrots. Continue to stir fry till all are incorporated.
Top with the seafood from Step 2 and off heat. Serve hot with chilies to enjoy !

title: Steamed Tofu with Century Egg and Meat Floss
ingredients_raw: ['1 block tofu', '1 century egg, diced', '1 tbsp meat floss', 'A handful wolfberries', 'Some diced spring onion', '75ml water', '1 tbsp oyster sauce', '1 tsp light soya sauce', '1 tsp sesame oil', '1/2 tsp sugar', 'Pinch of salt', '1 tsp corn flour + 1 tbsp water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "tofu", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "century egg", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "wolfberries", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "spring onion", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "oyster sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "light soya sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sesame oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "corn flour", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Place diced century egg on top of tofu. Steam on high heat for 5 mins.
Combine all ingredients for the sauce and cook till it boils.
Add sauce thickening and once sauce thickens, remove from heat and pour over the tofu.
Sprinkle meat floss over and garnish with wolfberries and diced spring onion. Serve hot immediately to enjoy !

title: Fried Egg with Braised Minced Sauce
ingredients_raw: ['1 tbsp cooking oil + more for frying egg', '1 tsp minced garlic', '2 tsp minced ginger', '1 chili padi, diced', '2 eggs, lightly beaten', '85g minced meat', 'Some spring onion, diced', '2 tsp soybean paste', '3/4 tsp light soya sauce', '1/4 tsp dark soya sauce', '1 tsp mirin', '1 1/2 tsp sugar', '4 tbsp water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "minced garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "minced ginger", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "chili padi", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "eggs", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "minced meat", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "spring onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "soybean paste", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "light soya sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dark soya sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "mirin", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "water", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Split the beaten egg into 3 portions. Heat up some cooking oil and fry egg. Halfway through frying, fold the egg into half and continue till egg is done. Dish and set aside before continuing with the rest of the eggs.
Heat up 1 tbsp of cooking oil in another pan and saute garlics, gingers and chilli till fragrant.
Add in minced meat, break them into smaller pieces and stir fry till no longer pinkish.
Add in rest of the seasoning with the mirin being the last.
Once the sauce cooks, off heat and sprinkle diced spring onion over. Drizzle the sauce and minced meat over the fried eggs. Dish and serve hot with rice to enjoy !
Drizzle the sauce and minced meat over the fried eggs. Dish and serve hot with rice to enjoy !

title: Sesame Oil Chicken u0026 Mushroom Rice
ingredients_raw: ['300g boneless chicken', '4 dry shitake mushrooms, rinse and soak in water overnight and retain 230ml mushroom water', '1 cup rice, rinsed and drained', '2 tsp cooking oil', '2 tbsp sesame oil', '2 tsp minced garlic', '15 slices ginger', '1 tbsp light soya sauce', '2 tbsp cooking wine', 'Some diced scallions', '1 tsp salt', 'Few pinches of pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "boneless chicken", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dry shitake mushrooms", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "rice", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sesame oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "ginger", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "light soya sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cooking wine", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "scallions", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Marinate chicken, cover and set aside in the fridge for at least 30 minutes (can be prepared the night before.
Heat up cooking oil and saute garlics until fragrant. Add in washed rice and stir fry briefly and add to rice cooker.
Heat up sesame oil and saute ginger slices until aromatic.
Add in diced chicken and stir fry briefly. Add in light soya sauce and cooking wine. Stir fry till chicken no longer pinkish.
Add chicken to rice in rice cooker together with the mushrooms.
Combine the sauce from cooking the chicken with the mushroom water, all should add up to approx. 1 cup (250ml) of liquid.
Add the liquid to the rice and chicken in rice cooker and cook on normal mode till done.
Fluff up rice and add diced scallions and mix well. Serve hot immediately to enjoy !

title: Pandan u0026 Peanut Tang Yuan (Glutinous Rice Balls) in Ginger Soup
ingredients_raw: ['8 pandan leaves', '150ml water', '70g glutinous rice flour', '70g pandan juice', '7g crushed peanuts', '7g palm sugar', '200ml water', '6-7 thick slices ginger', '15g palm sugar', '35g rock sugar', '1 tbsp pandan juice', '25g crush peanuts', '25g fine sugar']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "pandan leaves", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "glutinous rice flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "pandan juice", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "crushed peanuts", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "palm sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "ginger", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "rock sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "fine sugar", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Blend the pandan leaves with water and extract the pandan juice.
Mix glutinous rice flour with the pandan juice to form a non-sticky dough. Adjust accordingly with more flour or pandan juice till the dough is no longer sticky. Throw the dough into the mixing bowl a few times to increase its elasticity. Divide the dough into 9g piece each.
Combine the crush peanuts and palm sugar together. (If the palm sugar is in a block size, use knife to scrape them into flakes to use)
Coat the hands with some flour and flatten each piece of dough. Wrap in 1/4 tsp of the peanuts and palm sugar filling. Seal the edges and roll them into rounds. Continue till all are done.
Prepare the ginger soup by boiling water with ginger slices. Once the water boils, add in sugars and pandan juice. Cook till the sugar has melted before adding the glutinous rice balls.
Once the glutinous rice balls float to the surface of the soup, they are cooked. Serve hot immediately to enjoy !

title: Fish Maw & Crabmeat Thick Soup
ingredients_raw: ['2 chicken carcass', '500g chicken feet', '2 carrots', '1 onion', '1 bunch celery', '3 bunches scallions, white parts only', '10 slices ginger', '2.5L water', '25g fried/baked fish maw, softenedHow to prepare fish maw for Cooking: 1) Soak fish maw in water till softened.2) Cut them into rings/slices.3) Blanch them in boiling water with some ginger slices and a dash of huatiao wine.', '1 carrot, shredded', '5 dry mushrooms, soak in water till softened, sliced & retain mushroom water', '1 tbsp oil', '1 tsp minced garlic', '3-4 pcs sliced ginger', '400ml chicken stock', '200ml mushroom water', '100ml water', '4 pcs garlic chives', '150g crabmeat', '1 tsp sesame oil', 'Pinch of salt & pepper', '2 tsp corn flour+2 tbsp water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "2 chicken carcass", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "500g chicken feet", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "2 carrots", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "1 onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "1 bunch celery", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "3 bunches scallions, white parts only", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "10 slices ginger", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "2.5L water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "25g fried/baked fish maw, softened", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "1 carrot, shredded", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "5 dry mushrooms, soaked in water till softened, sliced & retain mushroom water", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "1 tbsp oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "1 tsp minced garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "3-4 pcs sliced ginger", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "400ml chicken stock", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "200ml mushroom water", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "100ml water", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "4 pcs garlic chives", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "150g crabmeat", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "1 tsp sesame oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Pinch of salt & pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "2 tsp corn flour+2 tbsp water", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
To cook chicken stock, cook on low simmer for 4-5 hours over gas stove without covering pot. Filter away all the ingredients & skim away the oils on the surface to get a clear soup base.
Heat up 1 tbsp of oil in pot & saute garlics, ginger & mushrooms until fragrant.
Add chicken stock and mushroom water followed by the fish maw. Cook for approx. 10 minutes.
Add water and seasoning and cook for a further 3 mins.
Add the shredded carrots, garlic chives and crabmeat.
Add thickening solution. When soup thickened slightly, off flame.
Garnish as desired & serve hot immediately to enjoy !

title: Fried Fishcakes
ingredients_raw: ['250 mackerel fish meat, debonned and de-skinned', '1 tsp salt', '80-90ml iced water', 'Few pinches of pepper', '2 sprigs scallions, diced finely', '1 chili, diced finely', 'Some shredded parsley', 'Some cooking oil (for panfrying)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "250 mackerel fish meat, debonned and de-skinned", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "1 tsp salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "80-90ml iced water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Few pinches of pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "2 sprigs scallions, diced finely", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "1 chili, diced finely", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Some shredded parsley", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Some cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Scrape the de-bonned fish meat and discard the skin.
Add salt and pepper and stir in iced water and mix well.
Add mixture to a pounder and pound the fish meat till they turn really sticky.
Add in diced scallions, chilies, shredded parsley and mix well.
Wet the hands and shape the mixture into fish cakes.
Steam on high heat for approximately 10 mins till the fishcake turns opaque white. You can enjoy steamed fish cake as it is now.
Alternatively heat up some oil in pan and panfry fish cakes till golden brown on both sides. Once done, slice diagonally and enjoy !

title: Stuffed Red Bean Pumpkin Pancakes 南瓜红豆馅饼
ingredients_raw: ['200g pumpkin, cut into small chunks', '140-150g Glutinous rice flour', '1 tbsp plain flour', '1 tsp sugar', '1/4 tsp salt', 'Some cooking oil', 'Some white and black sesame seeds', '200g red beans', '180g sugar', '5 tbsp cooking oil', 'Some water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "pumpkin", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "red beans", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "plain flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "glutinous rice flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "white and black sesame seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sesame seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "water", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Add water to red beans and cook until they are softened and can be easily poke through with chopstick. Add the softened red beans and the leftover red bean water with more water (if necessary) to blender and blend till fine.
Heat up cooking oil in pan and add red bean paste. Keep stirring on medium-low heat to prevent it from burning.
Add sugar and continue to stir.
Use a wooden spoon to scoop up the red bean paste and if it does not fall off, the paste is ready.
Off heat and allow to cool. Roll them into balls of 15g each.
Steam pumpkin with 1 tsp sugar until soft. Use potato masher and mash it finely.
Add sifted flours and salt and mix well into a pliable dough.
Roll the pumpkin dough into 30g balls each. Flatten and stuff a red bean paste ball. Wrap and flatten to resemble small pancakes. Continue until all the dough are used up.
Heat up some cooking oil and panfry the Red Bean and Pumpkin Pancakes until lightly brown on both sides. Drain excess oils on paper towels.
Garnish pancakes with sesame seeds before serving and enjoy !

title: Stir Fry Mee Tai Bak with Minced Meat
ingredients_raw: ['200g Mee Tai Bak noodles', '1 tbsp minced garlic', '1 tbsp cooking oil', '2 sprigs of spring onion (white parts only)', 'Dash of fish sauce', '80g minced meat', 'Some green vegetables', 'Some beansprouts', 'Some fishcakes', '2 tsp light soya sauce', '1/2 tsp sugar', '1/2 sesame oil', '3/4 tsp corn flour', 'Pinch of pepper', '1 1/2 tbsp oyster sauce', '1 tbsp light soya', '3/4 tbsp dark soya', '1 tsp sugar', '2 tsp ABC sweet sauce', 'Pinch of pepper', '100ml water']

instructions:
Heat up cooking oil and saute garlic and white parts of spring onion until fragrant.
Add in the marinated minced meat and stir fry till cooked.
Add in Mee Tai Bak noodles followed by the seasoning sauce.
Allow the noodles to simmer in the sauce till almost dry before adding fishcakes, beansprouts and green vegetables.
When all the vegetables has withered, add in dash of fish sauce and off the flame. Dish and serve hot immediately to enjoy !

title: Cream of Pumpkin Soup 忌廉南瓜汤
ingredients_raw: ['250g-300g pumpkin, diced', '2 tbsp olive oil', '1/2 onion, diced', '2 tsp garlic, minced', '250ml chicken stock', '200ml water', '3 tbsp cooking cream', 'Freshly grind sea salt and black pepper as seasoning', 'Some shredded parsley']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "pumpkin, diced", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "olive oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "onion, diced", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic, minced", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "chicken stock", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "water", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cooking cream", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "shredded parsley", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Heat up olive oil slightly and stir fry garlics and onions till softened.
Add in diced pumpkin and stir fry till pumpkin starts to soften.
Add in chicken stock and water. Cook till pumpkin starts to turn mashy.
Remove from heat and blend the soup with a food processor or blender.
Put the pumpkin soup back onto the stove and add cooking cream, shredded parsley and seasoning. Cook the soup till it boils again. Once done, remove from heat and serve hot immediately.

title: Sardine u0026 Egg Fried Rice
ingredients_raw: ['1/2 bowl of cooked white rice, left overnight', '3 eggs, beaten', '1 tin sardine, diced', '1 tbsp minced garlic', '1 1/2 tbsp cooking oil', '1/2 tsp salt', 'Few pinches of pepper', 'Some diced spring onions']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sardines", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "eggs", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "spring onions", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Crack 2 eggs into rice and mix to coat rice with the eggs evenly. Add salt and pepper and mix well.
Heat up cooking oil and stir fry garlics with sardines.
Add in eggs coated rice and stir fry on high heat till cooked.
Push the rice to one side of the wok and crack in another egg.
Scramble the egg to mix well with rice. Off heat and add in diced spring onions. Stir fry briefly to incorporate the spring onions and serve.

title: Egg Tofu with Spinach u0026 Shrimps in Pumpkin Sauce
ingredients_raw: ['1 egg tofu, cut into 8 equal pieces', '1 pack of Chinese Spinach, cut into sections and discard the stems', '5 shrimps', '1 pack brown beech mushrooms', '120g pumpkin, diced', '230ml water', '1 tsp minced garlic', '1 tsp minced ginger', '3/4 tsp salt', '1/2 tsp sugar', 'Pinch of pepper', 'Some cooking oil', '2 tsp corn flour', '1 tbsp water']

instructions:
Heat up some cooking oil and fry tofu until golden brown. Set aside on paper towels to remove excess oils.
Steam pumpkin until soft. Mash it finely with a fork.
Heat up some water and blanch the shrimps till cooked. Remove and set aside. Using the same water, blanch spinach till they soften. Drain and squeeze out excess water from the spinach and set aside.
Add 1 tbsp of cooking oil and saute garlic and ginger till fragrant. Add mushrooms and stir fry till they are softened.
Add mashed pumpkin, water and rest of the seasoning. Stir to mix well and cook till it boils.
Add spinach and tofu. Allow it to boil again before adding sauce thickening.
Once pumpkin sauce starts to thicken, add shrimps and off flame. Serve hot immediately to enjoy !

title: Stir Fry Glass Noodles with Mushrooms u0026 Minced Meat
ingredients_raw: ['2 servings of glass noodles (soak in water till soften)', '2 tbsp cooking oil', '2 tsp minced garlic', '2 dried shitake mushrooms, sliced (retain water used to soak mushrooms)', 'Some cabbage', 'Some spinach', 'Some carrots shredded', 'Sesame seeds (for garnish)', 'Chili padi, diced (for serving with)', '80g minced meat', '2 tsp light soya sauce', '1/2 tsp sugar', 'Pinch of pepper', '250ml mushroom water', '1 1/2 tbsp oyster sauce', '2 tsp light soya sauce', '1 tsp dark soya sauce', '2 tsp fish sauce', '2 tsp sugar', '1 tsp sesame oil', 'Pinch of salt and pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "glass noodles", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "minced garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dried shitake mushrooms", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cabbage", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "spinach", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "carrots", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "oyster sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "light soya sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dark soya sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "fish sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sesame oil", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Heat up cooking oil and saute garlics and mushrooms.
Add cabbage and stir fry till they turn soft.
Add in marinated minced meat and stir fry till they are cooked.
Add in glass noodles and all the rest of the seasoning.
Stir fry till all the glass noodles are evenly coloured.
Add in spinach and shredded carrots. Continue stir fry till all the spinach has withered.
Add in diced chili padi if desired and garnish with sesame seeds before serving to enjoy !

title: San Lou Hor Fun 三捞河粉
ingredients_raw: ['500g Hor Fun Noodles', '80g beansprouts, remove the heads and tails', '8-9 pcs of Toman Fish Slices', '2 tbsp light soya sauce', '2 tsp minced garlic', '5 thick slices ginger', '2-3 tbsp cooking oil', '3 tsp corn flour', '1 tsp salt', '1/2 tsp sugar', '1 tbsp cooking wine', 'Few pinches of pepper', '250ml chicken stock', '350ml water', '2 tsp light soya sauce', '1/2 tsp sugar', '1/4 tsp pepper', '3 tbsp corn flour mixed with 5 tbsp water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Hor Fun Noodles", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "beansprouts", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Toman Fish Slices", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "light soya sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "minced garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "ginger", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "corn flour", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cooking wine", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "chicken stock", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "spring onions", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Marinate the fish slices with salt, sugar, corn flour and enough water to cover the fish for 20 mins. Then drain away the water and add cooking wine and pepper to marinate the fish further for another 20 mins.
In a pan, heat up cooking oil and stir fry Hor Fun with light soya sauce on medium-high heat till they loosen up. After the Hor Fun loosen and turn soft, dish them onto serving plates.
With residual oil in pan, add minced garlics and beansprouts and stir fry till beansprouts turn translucent. Remove the beansprouts and add onto the Hor Fun.
In the same pan, add chicken stock, water and ginger slices and cook till it boils. Remove ginger slices and add rest of the seasoning and fish slices.
Once the fish turn opaque white, add in sauce thickening. Once sauce thickens, add in spring onions.
After the sauce cooks again, off heat and pour gravy over the beansprouts and Hor Fun. Serve hot immediately to enjoy !

title: Mee Tai Bak Noodles in Mushroom Thick Soup with Meatballs
ingredients_raw: ['6 dried mushrooms, rinse and soak in approx. 400ml of water overnight to soften before slicing them thinly', '350ml pork bone soup base', '8 pcs ready-to-cook meatballs', '90g minced meat', '2 tbsp minced garlic', '4 tbsp cooking oil', 'Some diced scallions (for garnish)', '3 tsp light soya sauce', '1 tsp sesame oil', '1 tsp shallot/garlic oil', '1/2 tsp sugar', 'Pinch of pepper', '2 tsp oyster sauce', '2 tsp light soya sauce', 'Few pinches of pepper', '2 tsp Chinese cooking wine', '3 tbsp corn flour mixed with 3 tbsp water']
