instructions:
Heat up cooking oil and fry garlics until golden brown. Dish and set aside on paper towels to soak up excess oils.
Reserving 3 tsp of the garlic oil in pot, add the soup base and mushroom water and cook till it boils.
Add in soup seasoning and mix well.
Add in sliced mushrooms and minced meat. Use back of ladle to press against the minced meat to break them up finely.
When the soup cooks again, add in meatballs and Chinese Cooking wine before slurring in the soup thickening.
Allow the soup to cook on high heat till it starts to thicken.
In another pot, heat up some water and cook the Mee Tai Bak noodles till the noodles loosen up. Drain away the water and reserve the noodles.
Pour the soup over the noodles and top with diced scallions and fried garlic. Serve hot immediately to enjoy !

title: Fish Fragrant Braised Cabbage 鱼香包菜
ingredients_raw: ['1/2 cabbage, tear them apart by hand', '80g minced meat', '2 tbsp cooking oil', '2 chili padi, diced', '2 dried shitake mushroom, diced (soak in water till soften and retain mushroom water)', '1 1/2 tsp minced garlic', '1 1/2 tsp minced ginger', '1 tsp fish sauce', '2 tbsp mushroom water', 'Some diced spring onion', '2 tsp light soya sauce', '1 tsp cooking oil', '1 1/2 tsp corn flour', 'Pinch of pepper', '2 tsp spicy bean paste sauce', '2 tsp light soya sauce', '3/4 tsp dark soya sauce', '1 tsp sugar', '150ml mushroom water', '2 tsp corn flour + 2 tbsp water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "cabbage", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "minced meat", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "chili padi", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dried shitake mushroom", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "minced garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "minced ginger", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "fish sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "mushroom water", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "spring onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "light soya sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "corn flour", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "spicy bean paste sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dark soya sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Heat up cooking oil and stir fry garlic and ginger till sizzling. Add in diced mushrooms and stir fry briefly.
Add marinated minced meat and cook till the meat is no longer pinkish. Add in 2 tbsp mushroom water if it gets too dry.
Add in cabbage followed by all the seasoning. Stir fry on high heat and braised till the cabbage turns soft.
Add in sauce thickening. Once the sauce thickens, add in diced chili and diced spring onion.
Finish off with fish sauce. Stir to incorporate all together and remove from heat. Dish and serve hot immediately to enjoy.

title: Stir fry Instant Noodles with Cabbage and Luncheon
ingredients_raw: ['1 serving instant noodles / egg noodles', '1 1/2 tsp dark soya sauce', '1 tbsp sesame oil', '1 tsp minced garlic', '1 small carrot, julienned', 'A handful of cabbage', '2 thick slices luncheon, cubed', '1 egg, beaten', '1 tsp light soya sauce', '1/4 tsp salt', '1/4 tsp chicken powder', 'Pinch of pepper', '2 1/2 tbsp cooking oil', 'Some diced scallions']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "instant noodles / egg noodles", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dark soya sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sesame oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "minced garlic", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "carrot", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cabbage", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "luncheon", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "egg", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "light soya sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "chicken powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "scallions", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Cook noodles in boiling water and drain. Toss in dark soya sauce and sesame oil and set aside.
Heat up 1 tbsp cooking oil and stir fry luncheon cubes till the edges turn browned. Drain and set aside on paper towels to remove excess oils.
With the balance cooking oil in pan, make scrambled eggs. Set aside the eggs.
Add in balance cooking oil and stir fry garlic briefly before cooking cabbage and julienned carrots until softened. Add in some water if necessary.
Add in the noodles from Step 1 and rest of the seasoning. Stir fry on medium-high heat to incorporate everything.
Add in the scrambled eggs, luncheon cubes and sprinkle diced scallions over. Remove from heat and serve hot immediately to enjoy !

title: Golden Cereal Balls with Red Bean Filling
ingredients_raw: ['200g glutinuous rice flour', '1 tsp wheat starch', '60g sugar', '150-160ml boiling water', '3 tbsp cooking oil + more for frying', '160g red bean paste', 'Some Nestum Cereal']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "glutinuous rice flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "wheat starch", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "red bean paste", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Nestum Cereal", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Nestum All Family Cereal", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Combine glutinuous rice flour, wheat starch, sugar and cooking oil together. Add water and mix well to form a dough.
Knead the dough briefly till it becomes smooth and shining then divide them equally into 35g each and shape into balls.
Flatten and wrap each piece with 15g of red bean filling. Seal and roll into rounds.
Dip each ball into water before coating with the Nestum All Family Cereal.
Heat up some cooking oil and fry them till golden brown.

title: Mah La Gao (Steamed Cake) 马拉糕
ingredients_raw: ['180ml full cream evaporated milk', '130g cake flour', '80g plain flour', '1 tbsp instant custard powder', '2 3/4 tsp double acting baking powder', '1 tsp vanilla extract', '130g dark brown sugar', '110g castor sugar', '60g butter, melted', '60g cooking oil', '3 eggs']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "full cream evaporated milk", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cake flour", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "plain flour", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "instant custard powder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "double acting baking powder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dark brown sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "castor sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "eggs", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Combine and sieve cake flour, plain flour, custard powder u0026 baking powder together to remove lumps u0026 impurities.
Combine eggs, sugars u0026 vanilla extract. Use a whisk u0026 beat them manually till light u0026 fluffy with lots of bubbles, approx 4-5 mins by hand.
Add in melted butter, cooking oil u0026 evaporated milk to the egg mixture. Stir to incorporate them together.
Add in half of the flour mixture u0026 using a manual whisk, stir in flour gently to incorporate. Finish off with balance flour using the same way. The batter at the end should look thick u0026 smooth-flowing.
Prepare two 6-inch bamboo steamers by lining them with baking paper u0026 cut off the excess paper hanging over. Pour batter equally into both steamers.
Heat up a pot of water on high heat u0026 wrap the cover of the pot with a cloth to prevent water condensation from falling onto the cake.
Place bamboo steamer onto a steaming rack u0026 steamed for 35-40 mins. Insert a stick into the cake and if it comes out clean, it's done.

title: Caramel Popcorn with Cashew Nuts
ingredients_raw: ['75g popcorn kernels', '40g butter, melted', '60g cashew nuts, chopped into halves (optional)', '70g sugar', '25g dark brown sugar', '10g butter', '2 tbsp water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "popcorn kernels", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "butter, melted", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cashew nuts, chopped", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dark brown sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "water", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Place corn kennels into a 24-cm deep wok pan, preferably with a transparent cover that comes with a steam outlet. Add in melted butter and mix well to coat with the corn kennels.
Cover the pan with medium heat. The corn kennels will start popping after a while. Once the popping stops completely, off the heat.
Combine all the ingredients for the caramel sauce and cook till the sugar melted.
Add in the cashew nuts and continue cooking till the sugar caramelized.
You may adjust the sweetness of the pop corn by adjusting the amount of caramel sauce that is to be mixed with the pop corn. I used approximately 4-5 tbsp of caramel sauce for every 60g of pop corn. Stir the sauce evenly over the pop corn. I did this in small batches so that it’s easier to adjust the sweetness for different people. The caramel sauce will thicken once cooled down so be prepared to reheat the sauce when doing the next batch.
Spread the caramel pop corn onto a wired tray with a baking tray beneath. Toast it at 180 degrees C for 4-5 mins in the middle rack before removing from heat. Allow to cool completely before storing.

title: Char Siew Pastry 叉烧酥
ingredients_raw: ['1 tbsp cooking oil', '1 tbsp oyster sauce', '2 tsp dark soya sauce', '1 tsp light soya sauce', '1 tsp sesame oil', '3 tbsp sugar', 'Pinch of salt & pepper', '200ml water', '8 shallots, diced', '200g Char Siew, diced', '3 tsp corn flour + 3 tbsp water', '120g plain flour, sifted', '70g shortening', '10g butter', '140g self raising flour, sifted', '25g custard powder', '30g icing sugar', '1 egg yolk', '40g shortening', '40ml water', 'Beaten egg (egg wash)', 'Sesame seeds (for topping)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "oyster sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dark soya sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "light soya sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sesame oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "shallots", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Char Siew", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "corn flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "plain flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "shortening", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "butter", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "self raising flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "custard powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "icing sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "egg yolk", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sesame seeds", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Heat up oil to saute shallots till fragrant. Add in rest of seasoning except Char Siew & cook till it boils.
Add in thickening & allow sauce to cook till thicken.
Remove from heat & allow to cool before adding Char Siew. Cover & set aside in freezer.
On a floured worktop, rub butter & shortening into flour using fingers before combining all into shortening dough.
Prepare Flaky dough by combining all ingredients except water & rub shortening into flour before slowly adding water to form a dough.
Roll out Flaky dough flat & place shortening dough in the middle. Flatten Shortening dough slightly to adhere.
Wrap up the Flaky dough. Flatten it out again by rolling it flat. Then roll it up like a Swiss-Roll, turn it 90 degrees before rolling it flat out again. Repeat this for 3 times.
Roll it out flat for last time. Cut away uneven edges & divide into squares.
Add semi-frozen Char Siew filling into one square and top up with another square dough. Use fork to seal the edges.
Egg wash the pastry and top with sesame seeds.
Bake in pre-heated oven at 180degrees for 15mins.
